body_html:
Hi @ebrevdo , quick question....
What I don't understand is how to match the IDs in x with the IDs of your embedding.

For instance, if my sentence is "I like to run with dogs", and that is vectorized as
[5, 9, 2, 25, 16, 4], how will Tensorflow know that id 5 in the pretrained embedding matrix should correspond to 'I' and 9 to 'like', 2 to 'to', 25 to 'run', and so on?

so maybe we have something like
x=tf.placeholder(...) # [5, 9, 2, 25, 16, 4]
W = tf.Variable... # What the attached stackoverflow answer says
...

So when we do
tf.nn.embedding_lookup(W, x), how will this know that the first element of x (5) and the 5th entry in W are mapping to the same underlying word?

I hope my question made sense. Thanks in advance.

so maybe we have something like

So when we do

I hope my question made sense. Thanks in advance.
body:
Hi @ebrevdo , quick question....
What I don't understand is how to match the IDs in x with the IDs of your embedding.

For instance, if my sentence is "I like to run with dogs", and that is vectorized as
[5, 9, 2, 25, 16, 4], how will Tensorflow know that id 5 in the pretrained embedding matrix should correspond to 'I' and 9 to 'like', 2 to 'to', 25 to 'run', and so on? 

so maybe we have something like 
x=tf.placeholder(...)   # [5, 9, 2, 25, 16, 4]
W = tf.Variable... # What the attached stackoverflow answer says
...

So when we do
tf.nn.embedding_lookup(W, x), how will this know that the first element of x (5) and the 5th entry in W are mapping to the same underlying word?

I hope my question made sense. Thanks in advance.
